alert.note: Alert for Utah Valley; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80 (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 2:56PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Utah County through 330 PM MDT... At 256 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Vineyard, or 10 miles northwest of Provo, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Provo, Orem, Lehi, Draper, Pleasant Grove, American Fork, Eagle Mountain, Lindon, Alpine, Vineyard, Utah Lake, Saratoga Springs, Highland, Cedar Hills, Mt Timpanogos and Sundance. This storm will be capable of producing strong gusty winds on Utah Lake. This will lead to a sudden increase in waves and very choppy waters which will result in hazardous boating conditions. Boaters are urged to seek safe harbor if possible. This includes Interstate 15 between mile markers 269 and 283. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
